root.name: background()
root.description:
The background() function sets the color used for the background of the Processing window. The default background is light gray. In the draw() function, the background color is used to clear the display window at the beginning of each frame.
An image can also be used as the background for a sketch, however its width and height must be the same size as the sketch window.
It is not possible to use transparency (alpha) in background colors with the main drawing surface, however they will work properly with createGraphics.
root.syntax: background(gray) background(gray, alpha) background(value1, value2, value3) background(value1, value2, value3, alpha) background(color) background(color, alpha) background(hex) background(hex, alpha)

parameter.label: gray
parameter.description: int or float: specifies a value between white and black

parameter.label: alpha
parameter.description: int or float: opacity of the background

parameter.label: value1
parameter.description: int or float: red or hue value (depending on the current color mode)

parameter.label: value2
parameter.description: int or float: green or saturation value (depending on the current color mode)

parameter.label: value3
parameter.description: int or float: blue or brightness value (depending on the current color mode)

parameter.label: color
parameter.description: color: any value of the color datatype

parameter.label: hex
parameter.description: int: color value in hexadecimal notation (i.e. #FFCC00 or 0xFFFFCC00)
